Dear oirs,
The enclosed letter from the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters, Washington D.C.
explains itself. While their request is basically for
broadcasting there is also the question of reprin ing
"FOR ANNE GREGORY" and/or "POLITICS" in oamphlets to
accompany the broadcasts. So far as Mrs. Teats and
Messrs. Macmillan are concerned, there would be no
objection to this, and in the circumstances neither of
them would object to publication in English throughout
the world outside the U.^.A. free of charge. However,
I don't think that they can publish translations - they
may not want to - as it would involve too many foreign
publishers rights.
Any pamphlet or booklet would have to bear
an acknowledgment to Mrs. Tests and Messrs. Macmillan and
that the poems are taken from "COLLECTED POEMS OF W.B. YEATS".
Th*b poem* must be printed exactly as they appear in this book.
Would you be kind enough either to tell them
the foregoing, or to send my letter to them when you send your
decision about broadcasting?
This permission is valid of course only for
use in association with the broadcasts of The Voice of America
and covers pamphlets or booklets distributed free bf radio
listeners, or at cost. For anything else they must get in
touch with us again.
